doc:
Kathleen Harrison https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kathleen_Harrison 0 Kathleen Harrison (23 February 1892 – 7 December 1995) was a prolific English character actress best remembered for her role as Mrs Huggett (opposite Jack Warner and Petula Clark) in a trio of British post-war comedies about a working-class family's misadventures, The Huggetts. She later played the charwoman Mrs Dilber opposite Alastair Sim in the 1951 film Scrooge (US: A Christmas Carol, 1951) and as a Cockney charwoman who inherits a fortune in the television series Mrs Thursday (1966–67). Kathleen_Harrison ( 23_February_1892 – 7_December_1995 ) was a_prolific_English_character_actress_best remembered for her_role as Mrs_Huggett ( opposite_Jack_Warner and Petula_Clark ) in a_trio of British_post-war_comedies about a_working-class_family 's_misadventures , The_Huggetts . She later played the_charwoman_Mrs_Dilber_opposite_Alastair_Sim in the_1951_film_Scrooge_(_US : A_Christmas_Carol , 1951_) and as a_Cockney_charwoman who inherits a_fortune in the_television_series_Mrs_Thursday_(_1966 – 67_) .
